title: Bruno y el Monstruo del Almacén

content.translation: In a green forest lives Bruno the bear. Bruno loves history. His cave is not just a home; it is a museum full of old things: smooth stones, strange branches, and colorful feathers. Every object has a story, and Bruno loves his collection.
content.text: En un bosque verde vive el oso Bruno. A Bruno le encanta la historia. Su cueva no es solo un hogar; es un museo lleno de cosas viejas: piedras lisas, ramas extrañas y plumas de colores. Cada objeto tiene una historia, y Bruno ama su colección.

content.translation: One morning, Bruno sees something new in the valley. It is a huge, gray box. It makes a deep, rumbling noise. GRRRR... RUMBLE... GRRRR. Bruno's fur stands on end. He has never seen anything like it in the history of the forest.
content.text: Una mañana, Bruno ve algo nuevo en el valle. Es una caja gris y enorme. Hace un ruido profundo y tembloroso. GRRRR... RUMBLE... GRRRR. El pelo de Bruno se eriza. Nunca ha visto algo así en la historia del bosque.

content.alt: Un oso asustado mira un gran almacén gris desde detrás de un árbol.
content.prompt: A children's book illustration in a soft, watercolor style. A fluffy, brown bear (Bruno) is peeking from behind a large green tree. His eyes are wide with fear and surprise. In the distance, in a sunny green valley, stands a large, simple, gray industrial warehouse. The mood is one of suspense and mystery, but with a cute, non-threatening art style. No text in the image.

content.translation: "It's a monster!" Bruno whispers. "A giant, sleeping monster! The noise is its stomach growling! We need a solution, and fast!" Bruno thinks. "What is the solution for a monster? Honey! Monsters must love honey."
content.text: —¡Es un monstruo! —susurra Bruno—. ¡Un monstruo gigante que duerme! ¡El ruido es su estómago! ¡Necesitamos una solución, y rápido! —Bruno piensa—. ¿Cuál es la solución para un monstruo? ¡Miel! A los monstruos les debe encantar la miel.

content.translation: Bruno runs to find his friend, Sara the squirrel. "Sara! There's a monster in the valley!" he shouts. "A monster?" asks Sara, dropping her acorn. "Yes! But I have a solution! We will give it honey! Will you help me?" Sara is scared, but she nods. "Okay, Bruno!"
content.text: Bruno corre a buscar a su amiga, Sara la ardilla. —¡Sara! ¡Hay un monstruo en el valle! —grita él. —¿Un monstruo? —pregunta Sara, dejando caer su bellota. —¡Sí! ¡Pero tengo una solución! ¡Le vamos a dar miel! ¿Me ayudas? —Sara tiene miedo, pero asiente. —¡Está bien, Bruno!

content.alt: El oso Bruno habla con una ardilla nerviosa en la rama de un árbol.
content.prompt: A charming children's book illustration. Bruno the friendly brown bear stands on the ground, looking up and talking earnestly to a small, nervous-looking squirrel (Sara) who is perched on a tree branch. Bruno is pointing one paw towards the distance. The forest background is soft and slightly out of focus. The artistic style is warm, friendly, and painterly. No text in the image.

content.translation: Next, Bruno and Sara find Roberto the rabbit. "Roberto! There's a monster in the valley!" they say together. "A monster?" asks Roberto, his ears twitching. "Yes! But we have a solution! We will give it honey! Will you help us?" Roberto is very scared, but he joins them. "Okay! Let's go!"
content.text: Luego, Bruno y Sara encuentran a Roberto el conejo. —¡Roberto! ¡Hay un monstruo en el valle! —dicen juntos. —¿Un monstruo? —pregunta Roberto, moviendo sus orejas. —¡Sí! ¡Pero tenemos una solución! ¡Le vamos a dar miel! ¿Nos ayudas? —Roberto está muy asustado, pero se une a ellos. —¡De acuerdo! ¡Vamos!

content.alt: Un oso, una ardilla y un conejo caminan por el bosque con un tarro de miel.
content.prompt: Children's book illustration showing a procession of cute animals walking through a sun-dappled forest path. Bruno the bear leads, carefully carrying a large clay pot of honey. Behind him walks Sara the squirrel, and behind her hops Roberto the rabbit. They all look determined but a little worried. The style is gentle and colorful, with soft lighting. No text in the image.

content.translation: The three friends walk carefully toward the valley. They are quiet and nervous. The rumbling sound gets louder. GRRRR... RUMBLE... They hide behind a large bush to look at the monster. It is even bigger up close.
content.text: Los tres amigos caminan con cuidado hacia el valle. Están silenciosos y nerviosos. El ruido tembloroso es más fuerte. GRRRR... RUMBLE... Se esconden detrás de un arbusto grande para mirar al monstruo. Es aún más grande de cerca.

content.alt: Los tres animales se esconden detrás de un arbusto, mirando el almacén con miedo.
content.prompt: A tense but cute children's book illustration. Bruno the bear, Sara the squirrel, and Roberto the rabbit are huddled together, hiding behind a large, leafy green bush. They are peering out with wide, fearful eyes at the imposing gray warehouse in front of them. The pot of honey sits on the ground next to them. The scene has dramatic shadows but the overall style remains soft and storybook-like. No text in the image.

content.translation: Suddenly, a tiny voice says, "Hello! What are you doing with all that honey?" It is Bea the bee. "Shhh!" whispers Bruno. "We are giving this honey to the monster so it doesn't get angry!" Bea the bee looks at the big gray box and then at the scared animals. She starts to laugh.
content.text: De repente, una vocecita dice: —¿Hola! ¿Qué hacéis con toda esa miel? —Es Bea la abeja. —¡Shhh! —susurra Bruno—. ¡Le damos esta miel al monstruo para que no se enfade!

content.translation: "That's not a monster!" she buzzes happily. "That's a warehouse! It's a building where humans store things. In fact, that is the honey warehouse. They keep my family's delicious honey in there! The noise is just machines." The three friends look at each other. A warehouse? Not a monster?
content.text: Bea la abeja mira la gran caja gris y luego a los animales asustados. Empieza a reír. —¡Eso no es un monstruo! —zumba alegremente—. ¡Es un almacén! Un edificio donde los humanos guardan cosas. De hecho, ¡ese es el almacén de miel! ¡Allí guardan la deliciosa miel de mi familia! El ruido son solo máquinas. —Los tres amigos se miran. ¿Un almacén? ¿No un monstruo?

content.alt: Una pequeña abeja sonriente habla con el oso, la ardilla y el conejo, que parecen sorprendidos.
content.prompt: A bright and cheerful children's book illustration. A tiny, smiling, cartoonish bee (Bea) hovers in the air right in front of Bruno the bear's nose. Bruno, Sara the squirrel, and Roberto the rabbit look down at the bee with expressions of complete surprise and dawning realization. The scary warehouse is visible in the sunny background, now looking much less threatening. The mood is happy and relieved. No text in the image.

content.translation: Bruno, Sara, and Roberto start to laugh, too. They feel a little silly. They thank Bea for her help. Since they don't need to feed a monster, they all sit down together and share the sweet, delicious honey.
content.text: Bruno, Sara y Roberto también empiezan a reír. Se sienten un poco tontos. Le dan las gracias a Bea por su ayuda. Como no necesitan alimentar a un monstruo, se sientan todos juntos y comparten la dulce y deliciosa miel.

moral.translation: Do not fear what you do not understand. It is better to ask and learn.
moral.text: No temas a lo que no entiendes. Es mejor preguntar y aprender.
